definition: to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: Opened just did not expect the police seized 10 days.
sentences.chinese: 没想到开张刚10天就被警方查获。

sentences.english: We take away guns and bombs, the terrorists use box cutters.
sentences.chinese: 我们查获枪支和炸弹，恐怖分子使用美工刀。

sentences.english: Those caught sending yellow ones risked having their phone’s text function blocked.
sentences.chinese: 发送黄色短信被查获者，将封锁其手机的短信功能。

sentences.english: 12A customs officer stands guard over seized rhino horns in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 一名香港海关人员正守护在被查获的犀牛角旁。

sentences.english: The FDA also considers the seized Age Intervention Eyelash to be an adulterated cosmetic.
sentences.chinese: FDA还认为查获的睫毛增长液是一种掺假的化妆品。

sentences.english: The old war criminal is at last smoked out from his hiding place abroad.
sentences.chinese: 战犯终于被人从他在国外的藏匿处查获。

sentences.english: The picture shows Customs officers checking up the cars smuggled into China.
sentences.chinese: 图为关员在清点查获的走私进口汽车。

sentences.english: Chinese media reported more than three tons of pangolin scales were seized at a Shanghai port.
sentences.chinese: 中国媒体报道，超过三吨穿山甲鳞片在上海口岸查获。

sentences.english: The journal was seized in the dramatic US raid.
sentences.chinese: 该杂志被查获，戏剧性的美国的袭击。

sentences.english: The law enforcement officer closes to pay to the all of the adulterating of hunt down and seize mattress undertakes.
sentences.chinese: 执法人员对查获的假冒床垫进行全部收缴。

sentences.english: In several other countries, penalties for getting caught are cheaper than paying sales tax.
sentences.chinese: 在某些国家，被查获的罚金甚至还比销售税便宜。

sentences.english: Pigs have been used to help track down drugs and discovered several cases of drug smuggling activities.
sentences.chinese: 有人用猪协助辑查毒品，查获了好几起毒品走私活动。

sentences.english: He was caught with his fingers in the till and dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 他在工作的地方偷钱被查获，就被解雇了。

definition: to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to search for and seize (criminals, smuggled goods etc)
to make a full confession/to plead guilty
to be a suspect (in a crime)/to be suspected of
to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
